title: Oasis Kick Off Reunion Tour in Wales: Setlist and Photos
description: Liam and Noel Gallagher played the hits in their first show together since 2009
author: Walden Green
excerpt: Liam and Noel Gallagher played the hits in their first show together since 2009
text: Tonight, July 4, Oasis kicked off their long-anticipated reunion tour at Principality Stadium in Cardiff, Wales. Taking the stage together for the first time since their bitter breakup in 2009, Liam and Noel Gallagher ran through a set of hits and fan-favorites from across their discography, beginning with (What’s the Story) Morning Glory?’s “Hello” and making fans wait until late into the show for songs like “Wonderwall” and “Champagne Supernova.” Check out the full setlist and photos from the show below.Rumors of an Oasis reunion have circulated since at least 2017, when Noel Gallagher stood Liam up at a benefit concert for victims of the Ariana Grande Manchester concert bombing. Since the split, both Gallagher brothers have pursued their own projects, with Liam recording under his own name and Noel as Noel Gallagher’s Flying Birds. When news of a tour was confirmed last year, they wrote, in a press statement: “The guns have fallen silent. The stars have aligned. The great wait is over. Come see. It will not be televised.The first leg of Oasis Live ’25 will extend through the end of August, with the Gallaghers slated to play multiple shows in each of Manchester, London, Edinburgh, and Dublin. Dates in North and South America, as well as Australia, are scheduled throughout the remainder of the year. Exorbitant ticket prices, caused by Ticketmaster’s “dynamic pricing” model, have led to scrutiny from European regulators. The tour will be documented as a concert film produced by Peaky Blinders creator Steven Knight and directed by Dylan Southern and Will Lovelace.Oasis were among the nominees for the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame’s Class of 2025 but did not make the final cut. The Britpop titans recently shared that they’ll be reissuing their sophomore album, 1995’s (What’s the Story) Morning Glory?, in celebration of its 30th anniversary. Out October 3, the deluxe edition will include unplugged versions of “Cast No Shadow,” “Morning Glory,” “Wonderwall,” “Champagne Supernova,” and the single B-side “Acquiesce.”Oasis:HelloAcquiesceMorning GlorySome Might SayBring It on DownCigarettes & AlcoholFade AwaySupersonicRoll With ItTalk TonightHalf the World AwayLittle by LittleD’You Know What I Mean?Stand by MeCast No ShadowSlide AwayWhateverLive ForeverRock ‘n’ Roll StarThe MasterplanDon’t Look Back in AngerWonderwallChampagne SupernovaCARDIFF, WALES - JULY 3: Oasis-inspired graffiti mural by Cardiff-based artist Rmer on July 3, 2025 in Cardiff, Wales. Tens of thousands of Oasis fans will flock to Cardiff later as the band reunites on stage for the first time in 16 years.Photo by Matthew Horwood/Getty ImagesOasis fans stand in the queue for the official merchandise stand outside the Principality Stadium, Cardiff, as the band's long-awaited reunion tour kicks off in Wales. Picture date: Friday July 4, 2025.Photo by Jordan Pettitt/PA Images via Getty ImagesAn Oasis fan wears a bucket hat with the band logo outside the Principality Stadium, Cardiff, ahead of the first show in their long-awaited reunion tour kicking off in Wales. Picture date: Friday July 4, 2025.Photo by Jordan Pettitt/PA Images via Getty ImagesCARDIFF, WALES - JULY 04: Liam Gallagher of Oasis performs on stage during the opening night of their Live ’25 Tour at Principality Stadium on July 04, 2025 in Cardiff, Wales.Photo by Gareth Cattermole/Getty ImagesOasisPhoto by Lewis EvansCARDIFF, WALES - JULY 04: Liam Gallagher and Noel Gallagher of Oasis perform during the opening night of their Live ’25 Tour at Principality Stadium on July 04, 2025 in Cardiff, Wales.Photo by Samir Hussein/WireImageOasis’ Noel and Liam GallagherPhoto by Angus Jenner
html:
Tonight, July 4, Oasis kicked off their long-anticipated reunion tour at Principality Stadium in Cardiff, Wales. Taking the stage together for the first time since their bitter breakup in 2009, Liam and Noel Gallagher ran through a set of hits and fan-favorites from across their discography, beginning with (What’s the Story) Morning Glory?’s “Hello” and making fans wait until late into the show for songs like “Wonderwall” and “Champagne Supernova.” Check out the full setlist and photos from the show below.

Rumors of an Oasis reunion have circulated since at least 2017, when Noel Gallagher stood Liam up at a benefit concert for victims of the Ariana Grande Manchester concert bombing. Since the split, both Gallagher brothers have pursued their own projects, with Liam recording under his own name and Noel as Noel Gallagher’s Flying Birds. When news of a tour was confirmed last year, they wrote, in a press statement: “The guns have fallen silent. The stars have aligned. The great wait is over. Come see. It will not be televised.

The first leg of Oasis Live ’25 will extend through the end of August, with the Gallaghers slated to play multiple shows in each of Manchester, London, Edinburgh, and Dublin. Dates in North and South America, as well as Australia, are scheduled throughout the remainder of the year. Exorbitant ticket prices, caused by Ticketmaster’s “dynamic pricing” model, have led to scrutiny from European regulators. The tour will be documented as a concert film produced by Peaky Blinders creator Steven Knight and directed by Dylan Southern and Will Lovelace.

Oasis were among the nominees for the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame’s Class of 2025 but did not make the final cut. The Britpop titans recently shared that they’ll be reissuing their sophomore album, 1995’s (What’s the Story) Morning Glory?, in celebration of its 30th anniversary. Out October 3, the deluxe edition will include unplugged versions of “Cast No Shadow,” “Morning Glory,” “Wonderwall,” “Champagne Supernova,” and the single B-side “Acquiesce.”
